channel.title: mRPG Chat App on Android
channel.description:
Anyone fooled around with mRPG? I could totally get into low-key, small group or duet play on a dedicated RPG chat app.
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.adrianocola.mrpg

item.title: mRPG Chat App on Android
item.dc:creator: @Hopeless_Wanderer
item.description:
@Hopeless_Wanderer wrote:

Speech-to-text is your friend, here, I think. I have began using my phone as a laptop replacement at work, for about 90 percent of the work I have to do, and speech-to-text software is part of what has made this possible. I think, in the case of this role playing app, it would work too. The quality of speech-to-text transcription has improved dramatically in the last two years. The IME has It built-in on my phone.

Read full topic

item.title: mRPG Chat App on Android
item.dc:creator: @Curubethion
item.description:
@Curubethion wrote:

Seems cool, good for brisk RPG play throughout the day. I’m puttering around with a template for Swords Without Master. If folks are interested, I can give that a whirl.

Read full topic

item.title: mRPG Chat App on Android
item.dc:creator: @Big_Hammers
item.description:
@Big_Hammers wrote:

Trying this out now. Seems more like a chose your own adventure kinda deal but it does have a lot of features. Phone typing all the stuff you’d normally say in a game session could be tedious. Intrigued tho.

Read full topic

item.title: mRPG Chat App on Android
item.dc:creator: @dunadhaigh
item.description:
@dunadhaigh wrote:

I’ve wanted a really convenient means of casual, asyncronous RP. There are of course sites for this, but a chat app seems a little more immediate and easy to use.

Read full topic

item.title: mRPG Chat App on Android
item.dc:creator: @dunadhaigh
item.description:
@dunadhaigh wrote:

Anyone fooled around with mRPG? I could totally get into low-key, small group or duet play on a dedicated RPG chat app.

play.google.com

mRPG - Chat with dice rolling

Play RPG with your friends anytime, anywhere. With mRPG, players participate in the game when they can, without having to find a timetable that everyone is available at the same time and without having to spend a great deal of time to devote to an RPG adventure! CAMPAIGNS: Create RPG campaigns and invite your friends to play. You can play in multiple campaigns at the same time, with different game groups. CHARACTERS: The GM can define the template character sheet that every character in the ca...

Free

Read full topic
